intro: Cucumis ritchiei, commonly known as the Mexican bitter gourd, is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its long, slender, spiny fruits that are typically yellow or green in color. The plant is a vigorous climber with palmately lobed leaves and yellow flowers. Its fruits are used in traditional Mexican cuisine, often cooked and seasoned. The plant's botanical features make it well adapted to warm, arid environments.
